alert.note: Alert for Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 11:28AM MDT until June 17 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Forsyth affecting Rosebud and Treasure Counties. .Major flood stage has been reached in Billings with the Yellowstone river expected to crest around midday today. This flood wave will continue to move downstream impacting Treasure and Rosebud counties over the next 24 to 36 hours. Areas that have protective structures along this stretch such as the town of Forsyth may not flood, but many other areas will. If you live on or near the river be prepared for flooding that has not been seen in your lifetime as the river exceeds 1997 and 2011 levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Serious flooding is forecast for areas not protected by flood protection structures. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Forsyth. * WHEN...Until midnight Thursday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet in Forsyth early Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet in Forsyth, but areas unprotected by flood prevention structures will flood at much lower levels. - Flood History...This flood situation has exceeded 2011 and 1997 upstream of Forsyth in the Billings area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Significant erosion is occurring and riverbanks are being washed out. Please stay away from the rivers as even stable looking ground may be undercut and fall into the river when stepped on. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
